sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Peri hypsous, or Dionysius Longinus of the height of eloquence. Rendred out of the originall. By J.H. Esq; On the sublime. English Longinus, 1st cent. Longinus, Cassius, ca. 213-273, attributed name. Hall, John, 1627-1656.
[30], LXXXIII, [1] p.
Printed by Roger Daniel for Francis Eaglesfield at the Marygold in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1652.
A translation of: Longinus. De sublimitate. The attribution to Dionysius Cassius Longinus is spurious. Translator's dedication signed: J. Hall. Title page printed in red and black; first two words of title in Greek characters. Running title reads: Of height. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Nou. 22.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Peri hypsous, or Dionysius Longinus of the height of eloquence. Rendred out of the originall. By J.H. Esq; On the sublime. English Longinus, 1st cent. Longinus, Cassius, ca. 213-273, attributed name. Hall, John, 1627-1656.
[30], LXXXIII, [1] p.
Printed by Roger Daniel for Francis Eaglesfield at the Marygold in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1652.
A translation of: Longinus. De sublimitate. The attribution to Dionysius Cassius Longinus is spurious. Translator's dedication signed: J. Hall. Title page printed in red and black; first two words of title in Greek characters. Running title reads: Of height. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Nou. 22.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Francis Eaglesfield
Roger Daniel
the Marygold in Pauls Church-yard
